page.title: 18Political influences
page.content: Structure of Local Government. County Council, District Council,Parish Council. The Parish Council is responsible for Greatworth and Halse Wards. It consists of a chairman, vice chairman, seven councillors and a Clerk to the Council. The chairman is elected every year at the A.G.M. He presides over the council. He does not normally vote since he only uses his casting vote when necessary. The vice chairman acts as chairman when required. The clerk is the administrative officer and has no voting powers. He compiles the minutes of the meetings, acts as treasurer for the payment of all council accounts and is responsible for the presenting the balance sheet. Council members are elected every four years.
